entries.client_company_name: Star Petroleum Refining Public Company Limited
entries.client_address: No 1, I-3B Rd, Map Ta Phut, Mueang Rayong District, Rayong 21150
entries.project_name: Vibration measurement and analysis on gas turbine unit GT2 (Tag 57KGT104)
entries.project_description:
Vibration data was collected from March 10th to April 28th, 2025, using multichannel data collectors. Initial analysis at full-speed no-load (FSNL) on March 10th identified a rubbing issue at the power turbine (PT). Inspection of the PT impeller revealed rubbing at the seal rings. After initial clearances were adjusted and the unit was restarted on March 24th, the issue persisted. Casing expansion was later monitored with dial indicators on March 26th, showing no abnormalities.
The PT was disassembled again, revealing undersized oil seal clearances. These were corrected, and a 60-gram balancing weight was added to the impeller ring. The unit was reassembled and restarted on April 14th, resolving the rubbing issue. However, FSNL vibration at PT bearing #7 remained high at 8.5 mm/s RMS due to unbalance. After a balancing run on April 17th, vibration reduced to 4.0 mm/s RMS at FSNL but increased to 5.7 mm/s RMS at 14 MW baseload. A trial weight at the PT coupling showed no improvement. On April 23rd, a final adjustment with a 24-gram weight at the impeller ring reduced vibration to 1.0 mm/s RMS at FSNL and 1.5 mm/s RMS at baseload.
Separately, abnormal casing vibration at bearing #3 of the gas generator peaked above 11 mm/s RMS at 8 MW load. Additional data collectors were installed in the local control room for deeper investigation. Machinosis engineers provided data for client and OEM, who recommended field balancing the HP rotor. On April 26th, initial adjustments were made by removing MRT weights, followed by installing two 13-gram weights at ±15°. On April 27th, abnormal vibration was eliminated. The unit continued stable operation until shut down on April 28th. Equipment was removed on April 30th, and report preparation began on May 2nd.

time_entries.description: (Mr. Roengchai) GT2 started, tripped by excessive vibration at PT, and meeting.
Rechceck the modified signal connection and modify the data collector configuration.
Intention to monitor vibration during unit starting up. However, after several attempts, unit could not start due to lost flame.
monitor vibrattion during unit startup to full speed no load (FSNL). However, it was tripepd due to excessive vibration from rubbing problem.
Prepare data plot compare between 10 and 24 March.
Unit restarted as requested by OEM. After that, data preparation and meeting.
Prepare data plot comparison between 10, 24, and 25 March 2025
Meeting, test Keyphasor voltage, check casing movement, prepare result data plots for OEM.
(Holiday) - MCL engineer went to site to collect vibration data from client after PT startup and prepare result data plots for OEM.
Prepare 8+2CH data collector for GT seismic vibration (installed on next day). Prepare data plots for OEM to calculate final balancing weight.
Meeting, analyzed process data (data preparation and correlation) to correlate with the fluctuated vibration at GT bearing 3. Then, installing the 8+2CH data collector.
Prepare data plots comparison for client and OEM.
Review data plot and machine information, analysis data, and suggest the possible cause of problem.
Travel to site for meeting. Then start to monitor GT vibration from 15:00 to 22:00.
GT started up monitoring, meeting, showing 1X data with client and OEM.
Remove data collector from local cabin and instrument room in the control building.

entries.report_description:
The first report was submitted after data collection on March 10th, 2025 (Part 1). --> 4H
The second report documents vibration data from March 23rd to April 28th, 2025. --> 16H
